text.0: #POTS is very common in #rheumatic patients. These are common characteristics of patients who have postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome, says Tae Chung, MD from @HopkinsMedicine at #ACR20 https://t.co/qGAaXdjCwh
text.1: Dr. Darla Shores (GI) & Dr. Sam Alaish (peds surgery), Co-Directors of @Hopkinskids THRIVE, a center for intestinal rehabilitation, today discussed intestinal dysbiosis in necrotizing enterocolitis at the @HopkinsMedicine 14th Advances in Pediatric Nutrition Conference. #NICU https://t.co/ltDgR5WefG
text.2:
Happy birthday Florence Sabin, born November 9, 1871. She studied lymphatic and immune systems, was first woman to hold a full professorship @HopkinsMedicine, where she began studying in 1896. She advocated for women's rights and higher education.
#WomenInScience #WomenInMedicine https://t.co/hvery93J6u
text.3: November is National Hospice and Palliative Care Month. Learn about the extra layer of support that the palliative care team offers patients and their families by watching this video from https://t.co/KaU8TYZpNN. ##HospiceMonth https://t.co/48CfWyfos1
text.4: .@CHeBA_UNSW presents Professor Hanzhang Lu of @JohnsHopkins for his talk: Brain Vascular Function in Ageing and Cognitive Impairment https://t.co/sgAVzPyPM2
text.5: Happy #NationalRadTechWeek. Join us as we celebrate the importance of our radiology technologists and how they play a critical frontline role in ensuring patients receive outstanding and safe care while providing quality images. https://t.co/zJvxQMgyku https://t.co/gyKZceKzRk
text.6: Watch @RolandFaigle present about critical care needs after stroke reperfusion at the #ESOWSO2020 including new data about critical care needs after mechanical thrombectomy and the OPTIMISTmain trial @ESOstroke @WorldStrokeOrg @HopkinsMedicine @HopkinsSKSI https://t.co/xbpFSTKIX6
text.7: Johns Hopkins Neighborhood Fund grant helps #seniors remain active in #Baltimore communities, despite #COVID19 https://t.co/SQ4NmwCQWy
